config_description: Total permitted memory to use for memtables. Cassandra will stop accepting writes when the limit is exceeded until a flush completes, and will trigger a flush based on memtable_cleanup_threshold If omitted, Cassandra will set both to 1/4 the size of the heap. memtable_heap_space_in_mb: 2048
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration 'memtable_offheap_space_in_mb' is used to set the off-heap memory limit for memtables in Cassandra. The code snippet provided shows how this configuration is used to calculate the off-heap limit for memtables.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the 'memtable_offheap_space_in_mb' configuration depends on the memtable_cleanup_threshold value set in the configuration. When the memtable size exceeds the cleanup threshold, a flush will be triggered to free up memory.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'memtable_offheap_space_in_mb' configuration option on the system is significant as it determines the amount of off-heap memory allocated for memtables. Setting this value too low can lead to frequent flushes and potential performance issues, while setting it too high can result in memory wastage.
